oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shiloh National Military Park, "Gen. Johnston Monument and Tree Where He Was Wounded"
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Trees
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Shiloh National Military Park (Tenn. and Miss.); Johnston, Albert Sidney, 1803-1862
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Monument dedicated to Confederate General Albert Sidney Johnston and the tree near where he was wounded. The monument consists of an upright cannon and four stacks of cannon balls.
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: Shiloh National Military Park (Tenn. and Miss.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Albert Sidney Johnston was fatally wounded by what was probably friendly fire April 6, 1862. He was the highest-ranking officer, Federal or Confederate, killed in action during the war.
